meanings.def: a small round mark, especially one that is printed
examples: There are dots above the letters i and j.
Text and graphics are printed at 300 dots per inch.
The helicopters appeared as two black dots on the horizon.
The island is a small green dot on the map.
a white dog with a black patch on its head
patches of dense fog
The letters ‘i’ and ‘j’ have dots over them.
The island is a small green dot on the map.
The horse had a white mark on its head.
Which has spots, a leopard or a tiger?

meanings.def: a symbol like a full stop used to separate parts of a domain name, a URL or an email address
the shorter of the two signals that are used in Morse code
examples: Telegrams were sent using the complex dots and dashes of Morse code.

meanings.def: a small round mark that appears after a musical note to show that it should last for an extra half of its usual length, or above a musical note to show that it should be played staccato
examples: A dot after a note lengthens its duration by half.
The dot above some notes means they are to be played staccato, the opposite of legato.

meanings.def: exactly on time or at the exact time mentioned
examples: The taxi showed up on the dot.
Breakfast is served at 8 on the dot.
Please tell him I’ll call him on the dot of twelve.
I've been going there every summer since the year dot.

idioms.def: exactly on time or at the exact time mentioned
examples: The taxi showed up on the dot.
Breakfast is served at 8 on the dot.
Please tell him I’ll call him on the dot of twelve.
I've been going there every summer since the year dot.

related: dot your i’s and cross your t’s

meanings.def: to put a dot above or next to a letter or word
examples: Why do you never dot your i's?

meanings.def: to spread things or people over an area; to be spread over an area
examples: be dotted with something The countryside was dotted with small villages.
be dotted around… There are lots of Italian restaurants dotted around London.
dot something Small villages dot the countryside.

meanings.def: to put very small amounts of something in a number of places on a surface
examples: dot A on/over B Dot the cream all over your face.
dot B with A Dot your face with the cream.

meanings.def: to pay attention to the small details when you are finishing a task

idioms.idiom: dot your i’s and cross your t’s

meanings.def: a first name for girls, short for Dorothy
